annotation.TEXT: Wow, made it with over 5 seconds to spare! But, now for the incredibly tight second half, where I'll need EVERY second...
Okay, this green duder is really annoying. Sometimes, when you stomp him, you end up simultaneously kicking him, which can easily throw off your groove.
DOUBLE KILL!

Yes, I took the split-second to get that P at the start, since there's no guarantee I'll hit any other power up in the level, and I must finish at full health. Fortunately, this first section gives you a little bit of leeway.
Okay, when attacking the last trio of red bunnies, watch out for the hammer-spikes coming from below!
Wow, this run is going exceptionally well...
Oh, and the footage of the final seconds here is the very same footage I used near the end of episode 24.
The three 1-ups on the right have fake floor under them, but Nitori's Extending Arm makes them easy to get anyway.
I remember that there are 1-ups up here.
Now, for this part here where I collect the book with the Extending Arm, this is the exact same footage that I used for the end of episode 21. Yes, I'd already done this perfect run back then.
DOUBLE KILL!
First, let's see what happens if I collect a 1-up item somewhere...
Whoa, geez! I intended to bounce off of that FOE, but that works too!

Just made it, with about 3/10 of a second left on the clock! And yes, only Patchy can make that 5-tile high jump for the book in single player. I'd say that I had around 40 failures before pulling this off!
I'm pretty sure it's impossible for Alice or Patchouli to reach this one, and I've been told that you absolutely need Nitori's Extending Arm to reach it fast enough to still escape.
Surprisingly, I had 7 failed attempts on this relatively easy level. I think most of them were for dumb reasons.
Dropped to 998.
Made it! I missed one 1-up, but I don't care.
Okay, the door's around here somewhere...
Demo count: Cucumber
And now for the last level that needs perfecting... the dreaded 6-3, and its Gatling gun spirits.
Okay, first, I'm going to just trigger the green switch a couple of times so that the horde of enemies near the green walls clears out. (This was probably unnecessary to do, actually.)
Leave the blue switch OFF, but turn red ON. Also, these 1-ups are completely safe to get.
This part isn't quite as tricky as it looks. Just pay careful attention to the fairies' bullets, and be aware of the white FOEs dropping from above periodically.
Do be mindful of the enemy blocks here, and don't fall into the area where the lower chocolate duder is, since hidden blocks will trap you there.
As for the five 1-ups down there, maybe they're retrievable without dying, but the one time I tried it, I failed to make it back to solid land, so I've ignored them this time.
Walk carefully with the gaps in the bullets here, and make sure you're far enough away from the wall that you'll be walking towards.
Well, I guess that's it for Amapani (aside from BGM videos I intend to create and upload eventually). I hope you all enjoyed it!
There we go! BTW, if you just stand on this platform, the bullets those two fairies fire won't hit you. You can run right through them!
Oh, and on top of allowing Patchy to reach the book, the air dash speed boost is flatout required for Patchy to even finish this room.
The doll barrier can help here (although I didn't use it here this time), and being able to hit the second of these spirits with a doll from below (if you're positioned right) helps even more.
HARRY UP!
Almost there! Don't choke now!
And, there's that one last trapdoor waiting at the end, but since I'm jumping into the air for the items anyway, it's a non-issue. Hooray!
However, after I figured that out, I only had 2 more failures before succeeding there. Okay, now for 6-7, which also requires Patchouli and the air dash speed boost!
What if I were to collect enough point items for a 1-up? Will it stop that counter at 99 like a few other games do with such "collect 100 for a 1-up" items while you're at max lives?
And now for the final leg of the journey! Can I complete this room flawlessly?
So, remember this autoscroller that was actually kinda fun? (Way more fun than 6-3, at least.)
First, I've started the platform moving, and will wait up here for a few seconds.
Just look at all this groove-throwing-off!
Okay, I'm at the "sort of streaming" part. The movement of the platform naturally helps with this.
DOUBLE KILL!
Now, for this part, I wasn't aware of the air dash speed boost yet, but Nitori's just fast enough to make it anyway.
Next up is 6-6, which is the enemy gauntlet level, and it's really tough! Not quite as bad as 6-3, but still difficult.
Huzzah! Now, I'm not sure exactly how many failures I had here, since most of them were before I figured out the air dash speed boost thing. I want to say it's around 30.
Now to lead this blue guy through this little obstacle course.
Now, just like with 6-1's book, the footage of that I used at the beginning of episode 24 of me getting this book is from this run.
Same with these 1-ups. Really, once you know about all the tricks, this level isn't that difficult.
BTW, this is a separate file from our main playthrough, as I did play through the entire game again on single player. Also, most of these levels took many tries before I managed to perfect them.
Whoa, that was a close call there.
Whoops. That's okay, as long as the blue guy doesn't fall out of bounds.
Hold left as you start the level to dodge the immediate pitfall trap below you and land on the springs.

I was originally intending to show this whole 6-1 perfect run at the end of that episode, but I was barely able to fit that episode within 15½ minutes as it was, as I still had my copyright strike at the time.
Now, it's not strictly necessary, but I like flipping this ON/OFF switch just in case I screw up the very next jump (which I have done a couple of times).
Obviously, don't forget the book at the end here. But, since you can survive going a bit off-screen, don't worry too much about having to outrace the autoscroll here.

Whoa. Well, given that I was able to screw up with the Extending Arm once there and still make it, I think it might barely be possible to use Marisa's broom or Nitori's helicopter to get in and get out fast enough.
Woo-hoo! But, it's not over yet. There's still about 3/4 of the level to go, with more of those evil "more dakka" spirits to deal with.
Yes! That's perfect! The remaining enemies there will now fall through the gap I opened and eventually drop into the bottomless pit below!
Yes, I'm not actually hitting the checkpoint here. It's neither required nor helpful in a perfect run.
Yeah, that's actually a failure, but I thought that the way I failed there was funny, and decided to include that in this video. So, let's try this again, shall we?
Now, since these five 1-ups are really easy to get if you know about the traps in front of them, I will of course collect them.
Now for the second half, which involves ulitizing these blue FOEs. It takes me a few tries to make this first jump, but as long as I don't get hit, I'm still good.
Okay, I didn't get thrown off my groove that time. Now for one of the hardest parts of this level... getting the book without getting hit.

These things fire incredibly fast, and you have to break through the ice, so Nitori's Extending Arm is of no use here. You practically have to use Doll Barrier, and then try to time your escape with the brief openings in their shots.
Still at 999.
Awesome! So yeah, I believe 6-4 is the easiest Extra level, and I successfully perfected this level on my first try! This is the only first-try perfect I accomplished amongst the Extra levels.
Up next, 6-4. (I hadn't figured out how to get 6-2's book in single player yet, and 6-3 is ridiculously hard to perfect, so I skipped it for the time being.)
That ♠-switch there speeds up the platform some more, but it's totally not necessary. Also, I like to kill the last spirit here just because I can.
Otherwise, she's too slow to make it past the green walls down there within the green switch's time limit.

BTW, I don't allow the use of the pause menu to restart at the previous checkpoint in these perfect runs either. So, if I screw something up, like the bounce off of that blue guy to hit that switch, I have to start the level entirely over.
There's hidden blocks waiting to troll you when you try to jump to the goal here, so I just won't jump. Instead, I'll helicopter across!
OMNOMNOM!!! These 1-ups are delicious! I'll certainly get the obviously easy-to-get items, of course. Okay, so this level has been perfected! BTW, I failed 17 times before succeeding here.
Yoink!
Okay, now for 6-2, and its infamous book. Now, at this point, I've learned about the air dash speed boost.
But, is 999 truly the maximum? I'm gonna go back to 1-1 and investigate this...

Taking out that spirit ASAP is very important. Now, with only one spirit here firing at me, it's a lot more manageable, and at a certain point, I can sort of just stream its bullets until I reach the door.
I guess I'll gather all of these point items as well.
This is the "gotta go fast" level with the ultra-short time limits, and yeah, you definitely need the air dash speed boost to stand any chance of just clearing the level with Patchy!
Okay, now ignore the fake door with the fake floor under it, and jump to the right towards the real door.
Whoa, that was close!
I had a large number of failures on the right here where the FOEs just weren't cooperating with me.
Such death-defiance there! (But, at least if I screwed up there, I wouldn't have to redo much.)
Of course, if it's revealed that there are more playable levels in this game, I'll come back for them, but otherwise, see y'all later!
BTW, I failed 16 times while trying to perfect that level.
I think someone suggested to me that I should wait for like a couple hundred seconds for the platform to go all the way down, but I'm not gonna do that.
Sure, I'll grab that 1-up too. It's not that hard to me.
HARRY UP!
1-ups and point items are nice and all, but they're not required. Likewise, any additional power ups after the first aren't necessary either.
And, they're gone! Okay, now I just need to get the book...
Oh, cool. I got the book on my first try on this attempt.
So, yeah. Diagonally air dash onto the top of this wall to give Patchy enough speed to reach the 5-tile high platform here.
Bah. Missed the top point item there. Whatever.

Now, you likely will want to hit the ♠-switch on the right to speed up the platform, but DO NOT hit the ♠-switch on the left, or that chocolate dude will start moving and be a constant hazard for the rest of the level!
Ignore those point-filled star blocks. There's not enough time to waste on them.
But, by waiting until the timer reaches around 427 before dropping down, I won't really have to deal with them. Also, this spot is apparently where the white FOEs stop falling from above.
Mistimed that jump, but we didn't hit each other, so I can just try again.
Well, that proves it. 999 is indeed the maximum number of lives you can have in this game. Okay, let me get back up to 999 and then finish the level.

As for the book, well, it's probably one of the trickiest parts of this level, since it's difficult to judge your position while off-screen. But at least screwing up the jumps towards it won't result in an auto-failure.
Most of this should be doable while staying with the platform, although there is one spot where I'll wait on a block for an extended period of time.
Yep, I used the barrier for a split-second there.
Next, I'll burninate a white FOE in front of me just before I make my real attempt here...
In this area, don't try to go straight towards the goal, since there are traps there.
Okay, just the two hammer-spike bunnies and these two chocolate duders remain...
Yes, taking the split-second to kill that blue guy is important. Otherwise, he'll be in my way in front of the goal later.
Nope, that rolled over back to zero. Well, maybe I'm actually above 1000 lives now, but it'll only show up to 999. To find this out, I'll let myself get killed.
Now, the second half of the level gets really tricky. You want to break the ice and kill the killable enemies quickly while being ready to dodge attacks from enemies further below.

So, in order for me to consider a level in this game to be perfectly cleared, I must complete it without getting hit, and I have to collect the book and finish with full health, so I have to get at least one power up.
There are certainly some tricky parts to this level, but none of this is really that nasty.
I don't know why I didn't use the Extend Arm one more time for that single remaining point item there, but it's not important.
Up next is 6-5, which is the level with so many tricks that Tewi would be jealous (assuming Tewi didn't design this level herself).
Whoa, I didn't know about that before. Fortunately, that little trick there didn't kill me or anything.
Alright, now to drop down and land back on the platform.
Yeah, just keep shooting my now-invincible back. I don't care. So, I'd say that I had over 50 failures before I succeeded at perfecting this level! Oh, and what's this? I'm now at 999 lives...
BTW, be aware of the hidden blocks over the yellow tiles here, which could interfere with your ability to jump over enemies in this hallway.
I suppose this is technically possible with any character, but I really want the assistance of Alice's doll barrier for this one.
At about this point, you'll start seeing red bullets coming at you, which you'll have to continue dodging for a while, until you can attack their sources.
And of course, I'm no longer using Nitori, since Patchouli is the only one who can jump high enough to reach the book.
Yeah, watch out for the springs surrounding that opening, which'll fling you into an inescapable room. Fortunately, my Nitori-copter halts my upwards movement.
Hello, and welcome to what I believe will be the final episode of Amapani! This time, I intend to perfectly clear every Extra World level! Let's start with 6-1.
Okay, this is where I'm going to sit and wait for a while, and by a while, I mean like 20 seconds. The hammer-spike and boomerang-bullet bunnies there are really annoying to me.
GOOOOOAAAAALLLLL!!!!!
